Expectation1: Be friendly and polite in daily interactions
Situation1: Having just moved in, they prepare a small cake to share with nearby neighbors when they happen to meet.
Expectation2: Follow traffic laws and drive defensively
Situation2: Roads are dry with light traffic and normal speed limits
Story:
I had just moved into the apartment last week, and today I finally had a chance to bake a small cake to share with my new neighbors. I wrapped it carefully, hoping to make a good impression and maybe spark a friendly conversation. As I was heading out, my phone buzzed—a ride request popped up. I hesitated, but work was work, and I needed the fare. I grabbed my keys and the cake, thinking maybe I’d run into someone on my way to the car.

As I pulled out of the parking lot, I spotted Mrs. Kim, the neighbor from across the hall, walking her dog. She smiled and waved, and I felt the urge to stop, introduce myself, and offer her the cake. But my passenger was already waiting, and I knew I couldn’t be late. As a taxi driver, I was expected to be punctual and follow all the traffic rules, especially with the roads so clear today. My heart pounded as I slowed near Mrs. Kim, torn between rolling down the window to greet her and the pressure to keep moving, stay on schedule, and drive safely.
